Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0b11pre) Gecko/20110130 Firefox/4.0b11pre

Load a lot of tabs and make Firefox crash.

After a crash, click on the restore button (in the "This is embarrassing" page) : tabs are restored in background but foreground doesn't change during a few long seconds, until the 1st tab is effectively loaded and finally replace the "This is embarrassing" page (in my case the tab is Gmail).

From a user point of view, not having immediate feedback, especially in such circumstances (trying to restore from a crash), is not good.

I suggest to replace the "This is embarrassing" page with a blank page (or blank page with a "please wait" message) immediately after the user clicked on the restore button, without waiting that the restored tab is effectively loaded.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Load a lot of tabs and make Firefox crash.
2.click on the restore button

Actual Results:  
wait during some long seconds before being able to get feedback

Expected Results:  
firefox should provide immediate feedback (i.e. replace the "This is embarrassing" page with a blank page or display a "please wait" message) until the tab is restored
